tag.name: dbform
tag.summary: a database application form (root element of a JSP view)
tag.info: this is the root element of a data manipulation form

info.p: the name of the table/view referenced by the dbform
not needed if form is empty!
Determinates how many times the body tag and its sub-elements get executed (evaluated & rendered):

ul.li: maxRows = n => body gets executed n times (with n elementOF N)
maxRows = "*" => body gets executed for every row in the table (=> "endless" form)

info.p: not needed if empty form
site to be invoked after action - nota bene: this followUp may be overruled by "followUp"- attributes of actionButtons

if "true", at every action (navigation, insert, update, etc.) all input fields of ALL currently rendered rowsets are parsed and updated. many rows may be affected. This can be very useful if people need to change lots of data, even multiple datarows, at once
if "false", updates are only performed if an explicite "update"- action is launched (normally by hitting the updateAction-button). Up to 1 row may be affected.
used in sub-form: field(s) in the main form that is/are linked to this form
used in sub-form: field(s) in this form that is/are linked to the parent form
pendant to the html-target attribute in html-form tag: the target frame to jump to
multipart must be set to "true" if the form contains file-upload tags or if the form may be invoked by a form containing file-upload tags, or if it containts fields of BLOB or DISKBLOB.
default is "false" (multipart-support off)
a SQL orderBy-CLAUSE (without the keyword "ORDER BY")
example:

ul.li: if you do not specify it here, you may define it globally in your dbforms-config.xml file. If you do not specify any information, DbForms automatically takes the key-fields for sorting.
remember field names are CASE SENSITIVE in DbForms framework (at least in current version)

info.p: definition of a FILTER. Format: Fieldname/Fielvalue pairs, seperated by , or ; or ~ symbol.
examples:

ul.p: since version 0.9, you can use <, > <= and >= operators, too!

info.p: allows to define a prefix applied to request parameters in order to provide a convenient and easy way of implementing navigation. Using this attribute may substitute the use of the more complicated and not very convenient GotoButton-Tag!
example:

ul.li: then you can call your jsp that way: customers.jsp?fv_id=4

info.p: => DbForms fetches the value of fv_id which is "4" and then navigates to the row where id is 4.
this attribute was added in release 0.9
allows to define a hashtable containing fieldName / fieldValue combinations which represent the value of a key (which can consist of more than one field, of course!)
example:
now, when a user calls aview.jsp?goto=234, then DbForms will navigate the table to the row where id==234!
there are many other ways you can use this facility. the only important thing is that the key value(s) in the hashtables refer to valid field names of the table.
this attribute was added in release 0.9
this attribute allows a JSP view developer to trigger WebEvents(NavigationsEvents) on the JSP. No controller interaction is needed. This attribute aims to make linkage between dialogs easier.
currently, the available "local web event"-commands are:

if a developer wants to show the last row of a table, then she/he could apply the value "navNext" to this attribute. Note that this attribute is evaluated in runtime, this gives additional flexibility
this attribute was added in release 0.9

tag.name: header
tag.summary: this tag renders a Header-tag. It should be nested within a dbform-tag

info.p: this tag renders a Header-tag. Itshould to be nested within a dbform-tag. because this tag is nested within a dbform-tag it is invoked every time the parent dbform-tag gets evaluated, but it gets only rendered at the FIRST evalation-loop.

tag.name: body
tag.summary: this tag renders a Body-tag. It should to be nested within a dbform-tag.

info.p: the body grouping tag

this tag renders a Body-tag. It should to be nested within a dbform-tag. because this tag is nested within a dbform-tag it is invoked every time the parent dbform-tag gets evaluated, AND it gets rendered in every evalation-loop (if there exists data to be rendered)

attribute.name: allowNew
attribute.info: by default this is "true" - if so, the body is rendered at least 1 time, even if there are no data rows in the table. this enables the user to insert a new data row. - to disable this feature, allowNew has to be set to "false"

tag.name: footer
tag.summary: the footer grouping tag. it is supposed to be nested within a dbform-tag

info.p: this tag renders a Footer-tag. it should be nested within a dbform-tag. because this tag is nested within a dbform-tag it is invoked every time the parent dbform-tag gets evaluated, but it gets only rendered at the end of the last evaluation-loop.

tag.name: label
tag.summary: this tag renders a dabase-datadriven LABEL, which is a passive element (it can't be changed by the user) - it is predestinated for use with read-only data (i.e. primary keys you don't want the user to change, etc)
tag.info: label - can never be used as input field

info.p: name of the field this tag references to

summary.p: label - a tag for data PRESENTATION, NOT data EDITING (=> can never be used as input field)

info.p: this tag renders a dabase-datadriven LABEL, which is a passive element (it can't be changed by the user) - it is predestinated for use with read-only data (i.e. primary keys you don't want the user to change, etc)

so far it is equivalent to DbLabelTag. But this tag may have a body containing any kind of EmbeddedData - tag! this feature was put into a seperate class for performance reasons (we do not want the overhead of pushing and poping the jsp writer to and off the stack)
name of the field this tag references to

tag.name: textField
tag.summary: this tag renders a dabase-datadriven TEXTFIELD, which is an active element - the user can change data

info.p: name of the field this tag references to

an instance of java.text.Format or any subclass of it. This instance is used to force DbForms to print out the field's value using a certain formatting style. this is done internally by invoking method "format(Object)" of the provided Format object

attribute.name: accessKey
attribute.info: The keyboard character used to move focus immediately to this element.

attribute.name: maxlength
attribute.info: Maximum length of the string to be entered

attribute.name: onBlur
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses input focus.

attribute.name: onChange
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses input focus and its value has changed.

attribute.name: onClick
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element receives a mouse click.

attribute.name: onDblClick
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element receives a mouse double click.

attribute.name: onFocus
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element receives input focus.

attribute.name: onKeyDown
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element has focus and a key is depressed.

attribute.name: onKeyPress
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element has focus and a key is depressed and released.

attribute.name: onKeyUp
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element has focus and a key is released.

attribute.name: onMouseDown
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element is under the mouse pointer and a mouse button is depressed.

attribute.name: onMouseMove
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element is under the mouse pointer and the pointer is moved.

attribute.name: onMouseOut
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element was under the mouse pointer but the pointer was moved outside the element.

attribute.name: onMouseOver
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element was not under the mouse pointer but the pointer is moved inside the element.

attribute.name: onMouseUp
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element is under the mouse pointer and a mouse button is released.

attribute.name: onSelect
attribute.info: JavaScipt event hanlder executed when the user selects some text

attribute.name: size
attribute.info: Size of the input field

attribute.name: style
attribute.info: CSS styles to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: styleClass
attribute.info: CSS stylesheet class to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: tabIndex
attribute.info: The tab order (ascending positive integers) for this element.

tag.name: dateField
tag.summary: this tag renders a dabase-datadriven DATE-FIELD, which is an active element - the user can change data. it is very similar to TextField, but this class provides an extension to TextField: the additional attribute "dateFormat".

info.p: name of the field this tag references to

an instance of java.text.Format or any subclass of it. This instance is used to force DbForms to print out the field's value using a certain formatting style. this is done internally by invoking method "format(Object)" of the provided Format object

even more convenient to use is the class java.text.SimpleDateFormat:
SimpleDateFormat sdf = new SimpleDateFormat("yyyy-MM-dd");
Format Pattern Result -------------- ------- "yyyy.MM.dd G 'at' hh:mm:ss z" 1996.07.10 AD at 15:08:56 PDT "EEE, MMM d, ''yy" Wed, July 10, '96 "h:mm a" 12:08 PM "hh 'o''clock' a, zzzz" 12 o'clock PM, Pacific Daylight Time "K:mm a, z" 0:00 PM, PST "yyyyy.MMMMM.dd GGG hh:mm aaa" 1996.July.10 AD 12:08 PM
(examples taken from Java API doc)

tag.name: textArea
tag.summary: renders a HTML TEXTAREA element

info.p: name of the field this tag references to

an instance of java.text.Format or any subclass of it. This instance is used to force DbForms to print out the field's value using a certain formatting style. this is done internally by invoking method "format(Object)" of the provided Format object

attribute.name: rows
attribute.info: how many rows does the textArea have

attribute.name: cols
attribute.info: how many columns does the textArea have

attribute.name: wrap
attribute.info:
may be:
"virtual" - text get wrapped optically
"phyiscal" - text get wrapped optically and physically (line breaks)

tag.name: tableData
tag.summary: external data to be nested into radio, checkbox or select - tag! (useful only in conjunction with radio, checkbox or select - tag)

info.p: this tag provides data to radio, checkbox or select - tags. it may be used for cross references to other tables.
see examples!

attribute.name: name
attribute.info: an arbitrary id declared by the user - this id is useful, if the same data should be used more than once at one jsp page. using this unique name the system is able to chache the data

attribute.name: foreignTable
attribute.info: the name of the table whre

tag.name: queryData
tag.summary: external data to be nested into radio, checkbox or select - tag! (useful only in conjunction with radio, checkbox or select - tag)

info.p: this tag provides data (provided by query result) to radio, checkbox or select - tags.

this tag provides similar functionlaity like "TableData", but as it allows to formulate free querys including all SQL statements your RDBMS supports, you have much more flexibility using this tag than using TableData (which is easier to use, on the other hand)
see examples!

attribute.name: name
attribute.info: an arbitrary id declared by the user - this id is useful, if the same data should be used more than once at one jsp page. using this unique name the system is able to chache the data

info.p: the query used to retrieve the data

query building convention: first column is the "key" column for the radio/check/select elements, all other colums are just "data" columns visible to the user
example: SELECT DISTINCT customer.id, customer.name, customer.adress, debitors.debit FROM customer INNER JOIN id ON (SELECT id FROM debitors WHERE debit>100000) ORDER BY debit DESC
- "id" will be threaten as key-value in select box, "name and address will be shown in select box

tag.name: staticData
tag.summary: external data to be nested into radio, checkbox or select - tag! (useful only in conjunction with radio, checkbox or select - tag)

info.p: this tag provides data to radio, checkbox or select - tags. This data is provided by embedded "StaticDataItem"-elements

this tag provides similar functionlaity like "TableData" or "QueryData" but as the names suggest, the values of TableData and QueryData come from a database, the data in in Static DataItem comes from the jsp page (from "StaticDataItem"-elements)
see examples!

attribute.name: name
attribute.info: an arbitrary id declared by the user - this id is useful, if the same data should be used more than once at one jsp page. using this unique name the system is able to chache the data

tag.name: staticDataItem
tag.summary: data to be nested into staticData element! (see description of staticData for further details)

tag.name: file
tag.summary: this tag renders an UPLOAD-button for uploading files into BLOBs or DISKBLOBs

info.p: version 0.7 provides a first implementation of file upload support. It is far from being completed. Improvements in functionality and performance can be expected.
name of the field this tag references to
MIME(s)-types of the fields to be uploaded. you may use wildcards as well
example: accept="text/*" for text, htm, html,etc.
keep in mind that not all browsers support MIME type filtering.

tag.name: radio
tag.summary: renders a HTML RADIO element or a whole group of them

info.p: radio tag, may be a radio group as well and it may contain nested DbData-Tags (like tableData, queryData, staticData, ...)
name of the field this tag references to
value that sould be used as default when form is in insert mode.
only needed if form is in insert-mode, otherwise the DbForms-Framework determinates the value.
determinates if this radio should be selected by default when form is in insert mode
only needed if form is in insert-mode, otherwise the DbForms-Framework determinates whether a radio should be selected or not.

attribute.name: growDirection
attribute.info: for radio groups only: in which direction should the group grow: valid values are "horizontal" and "vertical"

tag.name: checkbox
tag.summary: renders a HTML CHECKBOX element or a whole group of them

info.p: radio tag, may be a radio group as well and it may contain nested DbData-Tags (like tableData, queryData, staticData, ...)
name of the field this tag references to
value that sould be used as default when form is in insert mode
only needed if parentForm is in "insert-mode", otherwise the DbForms-Framework determinates the value.
determinates if this checkbox should be checked by default when form is in insert mode
only needed if parentForm is in "insert-mode", otherwise the DbForms-Framework determinates whether a checkbox should be selected or not.

attribute.name: growDirection
attribute.info: for checkbox groups only: in which direction should the group grow: valid values are "horizontal" and "vertical"

tag.name: select
tag.summary: This tag renders a html SELECT element including embedded OPTION elements.

info.p:
select tag, may contain nested "DbData"-Tags (OR "dboption" tags, which are not implemented yet)
examples for DbData-Tags are tableData, queryData, staticData

info
"dboption"- tags are expected for the next release
name of the field this tag references to
how many rows should the select box have

tag.name: linkURL
tag.summary: generates a link to a DbForms View
tag.info:
generates a link to a DbForms View. Setting the position attribute will force DbForms to navigate to this position within the destination-table
the 3 examles below produce all the same result
<linkURL href="customer.jsp" table="customer" position="103~2" />
<linkURL href="customer.jsp" table="customer" position="<%= currentKey %>" />
<linkURL href="customer.jsp" table="customer" >
   <position field="id" value="103" />
   <position field="cust_lang" value="2" />
</link>

attribute.name: href
attribute.info: the url of the JSP file representing the view

attribute.name: tableName
attribute.info: the url of the table the view represents

attribute.name: position
attribute.info: optional: the position to navigate to within table "tableName"

tag.name: position
tag.summary: element to be embedded inside a linkURL-element
tag.info:
example:
<linkURL href="customer.jsp" table="customer" >
   <position field="id" value="103" />
   <position field="cust_lang" value="2" />
</link>

attribute.name: fieldName
attribute.info: name of the key-field

tag.attribute: value true true value of the key field

tag.name: insertButton
tag.summary: this tag renders an INSERT-button

info.p: this tag renders an insert-button
the button is hidden if embedding form is not in insert mode

attribute.name: flavor
attribute.info:
styling of the button choices:
standard a standard form button. if you use it you should specify "caption"
image an image-button. if you use it you should specify "src" and "alt"
modern a fancy button according to HTML4; dont use if no all of your users have got 5th-generation browsers! You may embed any code into this tag. (see docu or www.w3.org)

attribute.name: caption
attribute.info: caption of the button (use it if the chosen flavor is "standard")

attribute.name: src
attribute.info: source of the image (use it if the coosen flavor is "image")

attribute.name: alt
attribute.info: alternative to image (use it if the coosen flavor is "image")

info.p: site to be invoked after this button has been clicked and the associated actions are done
this attribute over-rules the followUp-attribute of the parent form(s)!

attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element is under the mouse pointer and the pointer is moved.

attribute.name: onMouseOut
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element was under the mouse pointer but the pointer was moved outside the element.

attribute.name: onMouseOver
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element was not under the mouse pointer but the pointer is moved inside the element.

attribute.name: onMouseUp
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element is under the mouse pointer and a mouse button is released.

attribute.name: style
attribute.info: CSS styles to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: styleClass
attribute.info: CSS stylesheet class to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: tabIndex
attribute.info: The tab order (ascending positive integers) for this element.

tag.name: deleteButton
tag.summary: this tag renders a DELETE-button

info.p: delete button
the button is hidden if embedding form is in insert mode

attribute.name: flavor
attribute.info:
styling of the button choices:
standard a standard form button. if you use it you should specify "caption"
image an image-button. if you use it you should specify "src" and "alt"
modern a fancy button according to HTML4; dont use if no all of your users have got 5th-generation browsers! You may embed any code into this tag. (see docu or www.w3.org)

attribute.name: caption
attribute.info: caption of the button (use it if the chosen flavor is "standard")

attribute.name: src
attribute.info: source of the image (use it if the coosen flavor is "image")

attribute.name: alt
attribute.info: alternative to image (use it if the coosen flavor is "image")

info.p: site to be invoked after this button has been clicked and the associated actions are done
this attribute over-rules the followUp-attribute of the parent form(s)!
determinates the unique name of a data-row-marking "radio"-element (this MUST extist on the same JSP - page as this button!
it should be used if this button should be rendered only once and not for every row that could/should be deleted
see "associatedRadio"-tag for further information!

tag.name: base
tag.summary: renders a HTML-BASE tag

info.p: Renders a HTML "base" element with a "href"- attribute pointing to the absolute location of the enclosing JSP page. The presence of this tag allows the browser to resolve relative URL's to images, CSS stylesheets and other resources in a manner independent of the URL used to call the ControllerServlet. You should use this tag in all your JSP-views (see examples in distribution)
There are no attributes associated with this tag.

tag.name: errors
tag.summary: Custom tag that renders error messages if an appropriate request attribute has been created.

info.p: caption of the error-list
default = "Error:"
the name that should be used for retrieving the error-data from the session
default = "errors"

tag.name: associatedRadio

summary.p: This tag enables the end-user to define a row by selecting the radio-button rendered by this tag

tag.info:
example: imagine a table "customer". The rows of this table should be listed. The user should be able to delete a customer.
in that case the application developer has to alternatives:
to put a "deleteButton" into the body -> this button gets rendered for every row
if the user klicks the button the associated data row gets deleted. the disadvantage of this method is that multiple buttons must be rendered, which takes away lots of space and makes layouting more difficult
to put an "associatedRadio" into the body and the "deleteButton" on the footer (or header)
the radio element gets rendered for every row, the deleteButton just once. if the user wants to delete a row, he/she has to select the radioButton (to mark the row he/she wants to be deleted) and then to press the deleteButton.
the more buttons you have the better this method is!!
nota bene: you have to tell the delete (or insert, update...) - button that there exists an associated radio button that marks the row the action should be applied to, by defining the "associatedRadio" attribute of that respective button.

info.p: a unique name for the radio box. this name is used by buttons like "deleteButton" or "updateButton" to lookup the valio of this radio!
see "deleteButton" or "updateButton" for further information!

summary.p: This tag generates an URL pointing to a servlet downloading the DISKBLOB referenced by fieldname

info.p: use cases:

ul.li: rendering an image: " alt="a picture">

info.p: name of the field this tag references to

summary.p: this tag rendes a select box for switching the order-state of a field (ascending, descending, none)
(this tag is full functional but still subject of change)

info.p: name of the field this tag references to

tag.name: style
tag.summary: generic style tag

info.p: name of the template to be included
part of the template to be invoked
parameter list used to specify rendering properties for the template

tag.name: templateParam
tag.summary: param name

info.p: name of the template param to evaluate

p.b: only used in template (_begin.jsp / _end.jsp) - definition files!

info.p: default value to choose if no value specified in paramList - attribute in the db:style tag of the embedded jsp

ul.li:
if the parameter describes a ressource then dir should be set to the directory containing that resource. this attribute notes RELATIVE to the directory of the current template.
if your template is placed in /templates/mytemplate/ and you have images in a directory /templates/mytemplate/img/ than just note dir as "img". if the images (or other resources) are in the /templates/mytemplate you may set dir to "."

if you skip this attribute, then no directory will be written out. then only the actual value of the param gets written out
(for example if the parameter is "bgcolor=#343434" then you definitly would not want any directories to be involved!!

tag.name: templateBasedir
tag.summary: writes out base dir of the current template

p.b: only used in template (_begin.jsp / _end.jsp) - definition files!
